did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: This collection consists of one screenplay entitled Bandolero!, written by James Lee Barrett in 1967. The resulting film starred James Stewart and Dean Martin, and centered around a bank robbery in Texas and subsequent chase into Mexican, "bandolero"-held territory.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: Born on 1929 November 19, James Lee Barrett served in the United States Marine Corps before becoming a screenwriter. Many of Barrett’s films were western- or military-related, and his better known works included Smokey and the Bandit (1977), The Green Berets (1968), Shenandoah (1965), and The Greatest Story Ever Told (1965). Many films produced from Barrett’s screenplays featured well-known actors, including James Stewart, John Wayne, and Dean Martin. Barrett remained active from the late 1950s until shortly before his death on 1989 October 15.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of one series, Literary Productions, containing one “Final” screenplay, dated September 18, 1967, for the film Bandolero!. Written by James Lee Barrett, and based on a story by Stanley Hough, this screenplay is 153 pages in length. The screenplay also contains a series of revisions made by Barrett on September 26, 1967, and is in good condition.

Bandolero!, written by Barrett for the Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, centers around two bank-robbing brothers from Texas, and follows their various conflicts with law enforcement and “bandoleros,” or bandits. The brothers were played by James Stewart and Dean Martin, and the film also starred Raquel Welch (as a love interest) and George Kennedy (as a sheriff).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Prior to current processing, this collection was housed in a single folder with a basic description. The collection has been re-foldered and now has one series, Literary Productions.
